pullRequest.body:
And also improve the docstrings of the eight typeclasses. I always wished they told me what they state, rather than what nonsense they're the abbreviation of!


---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

bors merge

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!
Is this file supposed to be here?

I think this is easier to read as
```suggestion
* `PosMulMono`: If `a ≥ 0`, then `b₁ ≤ b₂ → a * b₁ ≤ a * b₂`.
* `PosMulStrictMono`: If `a > 0`, then `b₁ < b₂ → a * b₁ < a * b₂`.
```
I was split on the matter.

It would be cool if we could display this as:
```mermaid
graph TB
  PosMulStrictMono -->|α is a partial order| PosMulMono
  MulPosStrictMono -->|α is a partial order| MulPosMono
  PosMulMonoRev -->|α is a partial order| PosMulReflectLT
  MulPosMonoRev -->|α is a partial order| MulPosReflectLT
  PosMulStrictMono -->|α is a linear order| PosMulMonoRev
  MulPosStrictMono -->|α is a linear order| MulPosMonoRev
  PosMulMono -->|the multiplication of α is commutative| MulPosMono
  PosMulStrictMono -->|the multiplication of α is commutative| MulPosStrictMono
  PosMulMonoRev -->|the multiplication of α is commutative| MulPosMonoRev
  PosMulReflectLT -->|the multiplication of α is commutative| MulPosReflectLT
  PosMulMono -->|α is an ordered ring| MulPosMono
  PosMulStrictMono -->|α is an ordered ring| MulPosStrictMono
  PosMulStrictMono -->|α is an ordered ring| PosMulReflectLT
  PosMulMono -->|α is an ordered semifield| PosMulMonoRev
  MulPosMono -->|α is an ordered semifield| MulPosMonoRev
```

```suggestion
* when `α` is a partial order: `PosMulStrictMono → PosMulMono`, `MulPosStrictMono → MulPosMono`,
  `PosMulMonoRev → PosMulReflectLT`, `MulPosMonoRev → MulPosReflectLT`.
* `PosMulStrictMono → PosMulMonoRev`, `MulPosStrictMono → MulPosMonoRev` when `α` is a linear order.
* `PosMulMono → MulPosMono`, `PosMulStrictMono → MulPosStrictMono`, `PosMulMonoRev → MulPosMonoRev`,
  `PosMulReflectLT → MulPosReflectLT` when the multiplication of `α` is commutative.
* `PosMulMono → MulPosMono`, `PosMulStrictMono → MulPosStrictMono` when `α` is an ordered ring.
* `PosMulStrictMono → PosMulReflectLT`, `PosMulMono → PosMulMonoRev` when `α` is an ordered
  semifield.
```
etc: I read this last clause as modifying only the last list item originally
Be the module doc you want to see!
You've exchanged `right` with `left` in this docstring; I assume that's a copy-paste error?
Same throughout
Indeed I got confused with the layout of my new file, which is different.

Accidental I assume:
```suggestion
```
I'm confused by this; below you suggest that `OrderedSemiring` means that these are all automatically true anyway, and the fact that globally true statements imply each other isn't very interesting.

~~You're right. I had the scalar multiplication case in mind when I wrote this. It doesn't make sense here.~~

EDIT: Not quite, I can strengthen my statement to
```
* When `α` is an ordered group:
  * `PosMulMono → MulPosMono`
  * `PosMulStrictMono → MulPosStrictMono`
```
but `[OrderedAddCommGroup α] [Mul α] [PosMulMono α]` would be a weird mix of bundled and unbundled typeclasses, so I would rather not even mention it.
